Parameters: int: the number of seed bytes to generate.
engineGenerateSeed(int).Description: Returns the given number of seed bytes. This call may be used to seed other random number generators.

engineSetSeed(byte[]).Description: Reseeds this random object. The given seed supplements, rather than replaces, the existing seed. Thus, repeated calls are guaranteed never to reduce randomness.

Parameters: byte: the array to be filled in with random bytes.
engineNextBytes(byte[]).Description: Generates a user-specified number of random bytes. If a call to engineSetSeed had not occurred previously, the first call to this method forces this SecureRandom implementation to seed itself. This self-seeding will not occur if engineSetSeed was previously called.

ClassDesc: This class defines the SecureRandom class. All the abstract methods in this class must be implemented by each service provider who wishes to supply the implementation of a cryptographically strong pseudo-random number generator.
